abstract.text: Display text and check spelling.

inlineContent.text: In most cases, you can lay out your app’s text using the
class to add either a label or a simple text input. Use the
class to provide more comprehensive layout and editing features for larger bodies of text.
supports rich text, attachments (graphics, file, and other), input management and key binding, and marked text attributes.
works with the font panel and menu, rulers and paragraph styles, the Services facility (for example, the spell-checking service), and the pasteboard.
also allows customizing through delegation and notifications—you rarely need to subclass
programmatically either, because objects on Interface Builder’s palettes, such as
For even more powerful and more creative text manipulation (such as displaying text in a circle) see
class lets you define a spell-checking service and provide it as a service to other apps. To connect your app to a spell-checking service, use the

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
A protocol that responder objects can implement to correct a misspelled word.
An
object is a vertical matrix of
objects to implement the fields.
The
class is used to implement text entry fields in a form. The left part of an
object contains a title. The right part contains an editable text entry field.
A protocol that enables the Ignore button in the Spelling panel to function properly.
A view that displays a portion of a document view and provides scroll bars that allow the user to move the document view within the scroll view.
An interface to the Cocoa spell-checking service.
The most general programmatic interface for objects that manage text.
A list of alternative strings for a piece of text.
A protocol that describes specific kinds of input content types.
A set of optional methods implemented by the delegate of an
object to edit text and change text formats.
Text the user can select or edit to send an action message to a target when the user presses the Return key.
A protocol that a text field delegate can use to control its field editor action menu.
A set of methods that text views need to implement to interact properly with the text input management system.
A set of methods that text views need to implement to interact properly with the text input management system.
An object that represents the Cocoa text input system.
A view that represents the insertion indicator in text.
Options that affect the automatic display mode.
Constants that determine how to display the system text cursor in a custom text UI.
A view that draws text and handles user interactions with that text.
A set of optional methods that text view delegates can use to manage selection, set text attributes, work with the spell checker, and more.
Incorporate the system text cursor into your custom text UI in AppKit.

doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/App.title: Adopting the system text cursor in custom text views

abstract.text: Manage the fonts used to display text.
Manage text storage and perform custom layout of text-based content in your app’s views.
Add support for Writing Tools to your app’s text views.
A server that your app uses to provide a spell checker service to other apps running in the system.
